definition: partner
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
(Tw) variant of 擋|挡[dang3], gear
official records/grade (of goods)/file/records/shelves/slot/gap/crosspiece/classifier for crosspieces/classifier for events, affairs etc/Taiwan pr. [dang3]

sentences.english: The best parter for both music and fashionable mobile phone.
sentences.chinese: 不僅是享受音樂的好夥伴，更是時尚手機的最佳拍檔。

sentences.english: My loneliness and I are a pair of partners, like grudging .
sentences.chinese: 我，和我的孤獨，是一對善嫉的拍檔。

sentences.english: He referred to rumors in the graces of the hand-picked running mate Cui Jianbang any master of ceremonies?
sentences.chinese: 提到他欽點傳聞中得寵的崔建邦拍檔任司儀？

sentences.english: This will make you a better partner.
sentences.chinese: 這樣將使你成爲一個好的拍檔。

sentences.english: Restraint and repetition are two great allies of the guerrilla.
sentences.chinese: 剋制與重複是遊擊營銷的兩個最佳拍檔。

sentences.english: It pointed out the real criminal was Mr. Martin's partner.
sentences.chinese: 它指出了真兇是馬丁先生的拍檔。

sentences.english: Try to figure out if you think these guys are ever going to make a woman partner.
sentences.chinese: 試着去弄清楚這些傢伙是否會選擇一個女拍檔。

sentences.english: Her star partner's role is a tough-guy.
sentences.chinese: 她的明星拍檔的角色是一位悍漢。

definition: to cooperate/partner
helper/assistant
to be present/to be on the scene
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
opponent/rival/competitor/(well-matched) adversary/match
sports club member/footballer, golfer etc
to have a good talk
Malaysia
to act/to play a part
different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to supervise the manufacture of/to supervise the shooting of films/executive producer (film)
(fashion) model (loanword)
to lead a group/leader of a group/captain (of sports squad)
